thread.title: Man's hand almost severed in attack near Dunedin - another arrested
thread.title_full: Man's hand almost severed in attack near Dunedin - another arrested

author: Hamish McNeilly
title: Man's hand almost severed in attack near Dunedin - another arrested
text:
Man's hand almost severed in attack near Dunedin - another arrested HAMISH MCNEILLY Last updated 13:33, February 21 2017 Hamish McNeilly 
Emergency services at the scene of a machete attack at Taieri Mouth, near Dunedin. 
A man's hand was left "just" hanging on after suspected machete attack at a home near Dunedin, police say. 
Senior Sergeant Al Dickie said the incident was understood to be domestic related, and another man had been arrested. 
Are you in the area? Email us at Carolyn Leese 
Earlier a witness reported police cars "screaming" towards Taieri Beach. 
"The man gave himself up voluntarily outside the address when police arrived." 
Police had been unable to locate the weapon as yet, he said. 
Family members could be seen seen visibly upset outside the address following the incident in Taieri Beach Rd about midday on Tuesday. 
No charges had been laid yet. 
A St John spokesman said an ambulance and a rescue helicopter were dispatched to the scene at 11.59am. 
The injured man had been transported to Dunedin Hospital. 
Earlier a witness reported police cars "screaming" towards Taieri Beach.
